intro: Anthyllis vulneraria f. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered heal-all, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in Mediterranean climates. This subspecies is noted for its medicinal properties and historical use in traditional remedies.
